tasks:taskcard.description: General Visual Inspection of Forward Fuselage (below the Floor Line) Interface Connectors and Overbraids.
tasks:taskcard.title: INTERFACE CONNECTORS AND OVERBRAIDS
tasks:taskcard.tasks:procedure:
Interface Connectors and Overbraids in the Forward Fuselage (Below the Floor Line) - Internal General Visual Inspection General This task gives the procedure to do the internal GVI of the interface connectors and overbraids at zone 120. You must do the internal GVI at a distance from which you can touch the examined items. The purpose of this task is to make sure they are protected against lightning/HIRF effects. This maintenance technician is necessary to do this task: 1 - Mechanical Systems References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 34-61-00/1 FLIGHT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM AMM SDS 52-43-00/1 FORWARD AVIONICS-COMPARTMENT ACCESS-HATCH AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 Aircraft Maintenance Safety Procedures - Standard Procedures AMM TASK 24-23-00-840-801-A/200 Ram-Air-Turbine (RAT) - Retraction AMM TASK 24-23-08-080-801-A/400 Ram-Air-Turbine (RAT) Stow Lock Pin - Removal AMM TASK 24-42-02-860-801-A/200 Connection of the external AC power supply to the aircraft - Aircraft/System Configuration AMM TASK 24-42-02-860-802-A/200 Disconnection of the external AC power supply from the aircraft - Aircraft/System Configuration
Zones and Accesses ZONES ACCESS LOCATION REFERENCE 120 Forward Fuselage - Below the Floor Line AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-801-A/100 123BL LH FWD Fuselage Bottom - Front Area AMM TASK 06-41-00-800-801-A/100
Tools and Equipment REFERENCE DESIGNATION ITEM GSE 068 COVER - RAT BLADE ITEM GSE 189 PIN - STOW LOCK ITEM GSE 476 COVER - RAT HUB Commercially available Circuit Breaker Ring and Tag (Inoperative - Do Not Operate) Commercially available Workstand - cargo doors
Circuit Breaker List TYPE DESIGNATION LOCATION BUS LOCATION TIP MCDU PAGE CB ELEC RAT BIT LHCBP DC ESS BUS 1 - - SSPC RAT DEPLOY SPDA1 DC ESS BUS 1 SPDA1-M7 ELEC SSPC RAT HEATER SPDA1 AC GND SVC BUS SPDA1-M16 ELEC SSPC RAT TEST SPDA1 DC ESS BUS 1 SPDA1-M7 ELEC
Job Set-Up MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance (AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Connect the external AC power supply to the aircraft (AMM TASK 24-42-02-860-801-A/200). Put the Commercially available workstand (cargo doors) in position to get access to the zones where you will do the inspection. Open access hatch 123BL ( AMM SDS 52-43-00/1) to get access to the forward avionics compartment. Open this circuit breaker and put a Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) on it: ELEC RAT BIT-LHCBP (DC ESS BUS 1) On the MCDU ( AMM SDS 34-61-00/1), use the sequence in parentheses to open these SSPCs: RAT DEPLOY-SPDA1 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ELEC) RAT HEATER-SPDA1 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ELEC) RAT TEST-SPDA1 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ELEC) (Figure 629) KEEP PERSONS AND EQUIPMENT FAR FROM THE RANGE OF TRAVEL OF THE RAT AND FROM THE RAT COMPARTMENT DOOR. THE RAT AND THE DOOR MOVE QUICKLY AND CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS OR DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT. Remove the GSE 189 PIN - STOW LOCK (1) (AMM TASK 24-23-08-080-801-A/400). On the cockpit control pedestal, lift the RAT MANUAL DEPLOY cover (3) and pull the RAT manual release handle (2). KEEP THE PROTECTIVE COVERS ON THE RAT BLADES. THE RAT BLADES HAVE SHARP EDGES. IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THIS PRECAUTION, INJURIES TO PERSONS OR DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT CAN OCCUR. Put the GSE 068 COVER - RAT BLADE on the RAT blades. Put the GSE 476 COVER - RAT HUB on the RAT hub. Interface Connectors and Overbraids in the FWD Fuselage (Below the Floor Line) - Internal General Visual Inspection Use a flashlight and mirror, if necessary, to examine the interface connectors and overbraids. Make sure that all connectors and overbraids are correctly attached and show no signs of: Damage Corrosion Fluid contamination Job Close-Up Remove all tools, equipment and unwanted materials from the work area. Close access door 123BL. Remove the Commercially available workstand (cargo doors) from the work area. Remove the GSE 068 COVER - RAT BLADE from the RAT blades. Remove the GSE 476 COVER - RAT HUB from the RAT hub. Stow the the RAT (AMM TASK 24-23-00-840-801-A/200). On the MCDU ( AMM SDS 34-61-00/1), use the sequence in parentheses to close these SSPCs: RAT DEPLOY-SPDA1 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ELEC) RAT HEATER-SPDA1 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ELEC) RAT TEST-SPDA1 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ELEC) Remove the Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) from this circuit breaker, and close it: ELEC RAT BIT-LHCBP (DC ESS BUS 1) Disconnect the external AC power supply from the aircraft (AMM TASK 24-42-02-860-802-A/200). Put the aircraft back to its initial condition (AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Figure 629 - Ram-Air-Turbine (RAT) - Manual Deployment Figure 629, Sheet 1 Figure 630 - Interface Connectors and Overbraids in the FWD Fuselage (Below the Floor Line) - Inspection/Check Figure 630, Sheet 1 Figure 631 - Interface Connectors and Overbraids in the FWD Fuselage (Below the Floor Line) - Inspection/Check Figure 631, Sheet 1

Changed Task Effectivity Data FWD Passenger Door Cutout Structure - Internal General This task gives the procedure to do an ultrasonic inspection on the forward passenger-door cutout-structure at the upper doubler, between frame 17 and frame 18 from the inside of the fuselage. This procedure is accomplished from the internal side of aircraft, using transducer of the technique shear wave inspection. You must check the standardization periodically, during and after the inspection and before it characterizes and sizes any defect signal. If you observe abnormalities in the equipment operation or you find that the equipment is out of standards, all material you tested after the last time equipment operated within acceptable standards must be inspected again after the re-standardization has been done. Any equipment that satisfies the procedure requirements can be used to do the inspection. The Embraer GSE 503 CALIBRATION STANDARD is essential to instrument calibration and inspection. This inspection is applicable to zone 225. This inspection is applicable to SSI 53-10-008. Structural Significant Item(s): 53-10-008 - FORWARD PASSENGER DOOR CUTOUT STRUCTURE. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION CPM PART 1 TASK 51-25-00-910-001-A CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND - REMOVAL AND APPLICATION AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 Aircraft Maintenance Safety Procedures - Standard Procedures AMM TASK 25-22-07-000-801-A/400 Ceiling Panel - Removal AMM TASK 25-22-07-400-801-A/400 Ceiling Panel - Installation AMM TASK 25-23-08-000-801-A/400 Forward Passenger-Door Surround - Removal AMM TASK 25-23-08-400-801-A/400 Forward Passenger-Door Surround - Installation AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400 Cockpit and Passenger Cabin Insulation - Removal AMM SDS 52-11-00/1 FORWARD PASSENGER DOOR
Zones and Accesses ZONES ACCESS LOCATION REFERENCE 225DLW LH FWD Fuselage Side - Rear Area AMM TASK 06-48-00-800-801-A/100 225 LH FWD Fuselage Side - Rear Area AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100 227BLC LH FWD Fuselage Top - Rear Area AMM TASK 06-48-00-800-801-A/100
Tools and Equipment REFERENCE DESIGNATION ITEM GSE 503 CALIBRATION STANDARD Commercially available Workstand - passenger and service doors Commercially available Wiper cloth, lint-free Commercially available OIympus - MX Commercially available 5 MHz / .25x.25 - Aluminum Commercially available Lemo 00 / Microdot Commercially available Sonatrace grade 30
Job Set-Up MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Put the Commercially available workstand (passenger and service doors) below the forward passenger door. Open the forward passenger door ( AMM SDS 52-11-00/1). Remove the forward passenger-door surround lining 225DLW ( AMM TASK 25-23-08-000-801-A/400). Remove the forward passenger-cabin ceiling panel 227BLC ( AMM TASK 25-22-07-000-801-A/400). Do the insulation blankets displacement according to AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400. CLEANING PRODUCTS ARE TOXIC AND FLAMMABLE. A GOOD AIRFLOW MUST BE AVAILABLE WHEN YOU DO THE WORK IN CLOSED AREAS. Before you do the inspection, clean the area with a Commercially available lint-free wiper cloth soaked with water. Remove the CIC from the areas where it can hinder the inspection or distort its results ( CPM PART 1 TASK 51-25-00-910-001-A). Equipment Calibration Visually verify if there is an obvious damage in the Upper Doubler Main Door that may affect the inspection; (e.g. scratches, out-of-roundness, tooling marks). Clean contact surface as necessary to permit good contact between area to be inspect and transducer. Remove dust, dirt, grease, or any other contaminant that could interfere with sound transmission into the part or otherwise affect inspection results. Identify with non-permanent ink pen in the area to be inspected, in according with Figure 3. Calibrate the instrument as follows: Verify the Ultrasonic Instrument and accessories (e.g. transducer, Commercially available Coaxil Cable , power cable and reference block) for operation conditions, also check the Calibration Validity Date. Equipment standardization should be checked every ten minutes during inspection and at the end of it. If anomalies are observed in the equipment operation or the equipment is found out of standardization, all parts tested after the last acceptable standardization should be reinspected after the re-standardization has been accomplished. Connect the Commercially available Transducer 70º - A593S to the Commercially available Flaw Detector - Ultrasonic . Power-on instrument and allow 5 minutes for warm-up or proceed according to the manufacturer’s instruction. Adjust according to the manufacturer's instructions, setting the frequency, gain and other parameters as indicated below: Table 1 - Adjust Freq: 5.0 MHz PRF: Optimum Filter: Auto Display: A-scan Start: 3.97 mm Voltage: 100V Wave: Full Angle: 70º Material: Aluminum Wave Type: 3150m/s Gain: 42.0 dB Reject: 0% Attenuation: Off Range: 43.10 mm Wedge Delay: 0 us
Apply a thin film of Commercially available Couplant to the surface Standard Reference GSE 503 CALIBRATION STANDARD (Figure 1, Sheet 5). Position the transducer close the collar of the rivet reference standard of the no crack hole, moving the transducer smooth to obtain the maximum response of signal from the no crack hole, as shown in Figure 2. Adjust the instrument to set the no crack hole response at 40% of the CRT width. The amplitude of the no crack hole response should be set to 95% of the CRT screen height. Scan the hole with a simulated crack of 6.2 mm getting the best response signal, adjusting the gain (dB) of the reflected signal amplitude of the simulated crack 100% of the screen height in according with Figure 2. Procedure Make sure that the surface in the inspection area is clean and free of conditions that could affect the test through false indication. Position the transducer between the fasteners, the front hole to be inspected. Apply a thin film of couplant to the using contact surface according to the area to be inspected (Figure 3). Scan in every hole, moved smoothly on the transducer angle of -15 ° to +15 °, as shown in Figure 2. During scanning ensures that there is enough to avoid a gap between the transducer and the surface coupling. Indication Evaluation Note the locations of questionable crack-like indications. Repeat the ultrasonic inspection with special attention to the areas where the indications were noted. Record all locations and responses to all damage indications. Acceptance and Rejection Criteria If there are signs of damage, refer to the SRM to find the specific information applicable to your case. If the SRM does not contain the information related to your case, contact Embraer Technical Support Department. Job Close-Up Apply CIC to the areas from which you removed it or found it degraded ( CPM PART 1 TASK 51-25-00-910-001-A). Install the forward passenger-cabin ceiling panel 227BLC ( AMM TASK 25-22-07-400-801-A/400). Install the forward passenger-door surround lining 225DLW ( AMM TASK 25-23-08-400-801-A/400). EXAMINE ALL THE WORK AREAS TO MAKE SURE THAT YOU REMOVED ALL TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT AFTER YOU COMPLETED THE WORK. IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THIS PROCEDURE, DAMAGE TO THE AIRCRAFT CAN OCCUR. Remove all tools, equipment, and unwanted materials from the work area. Close the forward passenger door ( AMM SDS 52-11-00/1). Remove the Commercially available workstand (passenger and service doors) from the work area. Do the procedure to put the aircraft back to its initial condition ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Changed Effectivity Data 1 Figure 1 - Reference Standard Changed Effectivity Data 1-1 Figure 1, Sheet 1 Changed Effectivity Data 1-2 Figure 1, Sheet 2 Changed Effectivity Data 1-3 Figure 1, Sheet 3 Changed Effectivity Data 1-4 Figure 1, Sheet 4 Changed Effectivity Data 1-5 Figure 1, Sheet 5 Changed Effectivity Data 2 Figure 2 - Representation of Indications of Pattern on Equipment Changed Effectivity Data 2-1 Figure 2, Sheet 1 Changed Effectivity Data 3 Figure 3 - Forward-Passenger-Door Cutout Structure at Upper Doubler Between Frame 17 and Frame 18 - Internal Inspection Changed Effectivity Data 3-1 Figure 3, Sheet 1

Changed Task Effectivity Data FWD Service Door Cutout Structure - Internal General This task gives the procedure to do an ultrasonic inspection on the forward service-door cutout-structure at the upper doubler, between frame 15 and frame 16 from the inside of the fuselage. This procedure is accomplished from the internal side of aircraft, using transducer of the technique shear wave inspection. You must check the standardization periodically, during and after the inspection and before it characterizes and sizes any defect signal. If you observe abnormalities in the equipment operation or you find that the equipment is out of standards, all material you tested after the last time equipment operated within acceptable standards must be inspected again after the re-standardization has been done. Any equipment that satisfies the procedure requirements can be used to do the inspection. The Embraer GSE 503 CALIBRATION STANDARD is essential to instrument calibration and inspection. This inspection is applicable to zone 226. This inspection is applicable to SSI 53-10-009. Structural Significant Item(s): 53-10-009 - FORWARD SERVICE DOOR CUTOUT STRUCTURE. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION CPM PART 1 TASK 51-25-00-910-001-A CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND - REMOVAL AND APPLICATION AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 Aircraft Maintenance Safety Procedures - Standard Procedures AMM TASK 25-22-07-000-801-A/400 Ceiling Panel - Removal AMM TASK 25-22-07-400-801-A/400 Ceiling Panel - Installation AMM TASK 25-23-10-000-801-A/400 Forward Service-Door Surround - Removal AMM TASK 25-23-10-400-801-A/400 Forward Service-Door Surround - Installation AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400 Cockpit and Passenger Cabin Insulation - Removal AMM SDS 52-41-00/1 FORWARD SERVICE DOOR
Zones and Accesses ZONES ACCESS LOCATION REFERENCE 226FRW RH FWD Fuselage Side - Rear Area AMM TASK 06-48-00-800-801-A/100 226 RH FWD Fuselage Side - Rear Area AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100 228ARC RH FWD Fuselage Top - Rear Area AMM TASK 06-48-00-800-801-A/100

Open the forward service door ( AMM SDS 52-41-00/1). Remove the forward service door surround lining 226FRW ( AMM TASK 25-23-10-000-801-A/400). Remove the forward passenger-cabin ceiling panel 228ARC ( AMM TASK 25-22-07-000-801-A/400). Do the insulation blankets displacement according to AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400. Calibrate the instrument as follows: Verify the Ultrasonic Instrument and accessories (e.g. transducer, Commercially available Coaxil Cable , power cable and reference block) for operation conditions, also check the Calibration Validity Date. Equipment standardization should be checked every ten minutes during inspection and at the end of it. Job Close-Up Apply CIC to the areas from which you removed it or found it degraded ( CPM PART 1 TASK 51-25-00-910-001-A). Install the forward passenger-cabin ceiling panel 228ARC ( AMM TASK 25-22-07-400-801-A/400). Install the forward service-door surround lining 226FRW ( AMM TASK 25-23-10-400-801-A/400). EXAMINE ALL THE WORK AREAS TO MAKE SURE THAT YOU REMOVED ALL TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT AFTER YOU COMPLETED THE WORK. IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THIS PROCEDURE, DAMAGE TO THE AIRCRAFT CAN OCCUR. Pylon Lower Link Fitting (Pylon and Wing Fittings) - Internal General This task gives the procedure to do an internal ultrasonic inspection (by the manual contact pulse-echo inspection technique) of the pylon lower link fitting (pylon and wing fittings). You must do this inspection at internal side of pylon lateral fairing ( LH/ RH). To use this inspection method, you must get access to at least one surface of the part, near the area where you will do the inspection. The inspection is applicable to the zones: 419 and 429. The inspection is applicable to SSI 54-50-004. Structural Significant Item(s): 54-50-004 - PYLON LOWER LINK FITTING (PYLON AND WING FITTINGS). References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 Aircraft Maintenance Safety Procedures - Standard Procedures AMM TASK 24-42-02-860-801-A/200 Connection of the external AC power supply to the aircraft - Aircraft/System Configuration AMM TASK 24-42-02-860-802-A/200 Disconnection of the external AC power supply from the aircraft - Aircraft/System Configuration AMM TASK 52-46-00-000-801-A/400 Middle Avionics-Compartment Access-Door - Removal AMM TASK 52-46-00-400-801-A/400 Middle Avionics-Compartment Access-Door - Installation AMM TASK 54-50-21-000-801-A/400 Pylon Forward Fairings - Removal AMM TASK 54-50-21-400-801-A/400 Pylon Forward Fairings - Installation AMM TASK 54-50-22-000-801-A/400 Pylon Side Fairings - Removal AMM TASK 54-50-22-400-801-A/400 Pylon Side Fairings - Installation AMM TASK 78-33-01-040-801-A/200 Isolation Control Unit (ICU) - Deactivation AMM TASK 78-33-01-440-801-A/200 Isolation Control Unit (ICU) - Reactivation AMM SDS 34-61-00/1 FLIGHT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM

Tools and Equipment REFERENCE DESIGNATION Commercially available Wiper cloth, lint-free Commercially available Workstand - Engine/Pylon Commercially available Circuit Breaker Ring and Tag (Inoperative - Do Not Operate)
Circuit Breakers List TYPE DESIGNATION LOCATION BUS LOCATION TIP MCDU PAGE CB E1 REVERSER LICC DC BUS 1 - - SSPC E1 START VLV SPDA2 DC ESS BUS 1 SPDA2-M4 ENGINE CB E2 REVERSER RICC DC BUS 2 - - SSPC E2 START VLV SPDA2 DC ESS BUS 2 SPDA2-M5 ENGINE CB SLAT ACE 1 LHCBP DC BUS 1 FLIGHT CONTROLS - CB SLAT ACE 2 RHCBP DC ESS BUS 2 FLIGHT CONTROLS -
Job Set-Up MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. MAKE SURE THAT THE FLIGHT-CONTROL SAFETY LOCKS AND THE WARNING NOTICES ARE IN POSITION. THIS IS TO PREVENT AN ACCIDENTAL COMMAND OF THE FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES AND INJURY TO PERSONS. Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Connect the external AC power supply to the aircraft ( AMM TASK 24-42-02-860-801-A/200). Open these circuit breakers and put a Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) on each one of them: SLAT ACE 1-LHCBP (DC BUS 1 FLIGHT CONTROLS) SLAT ACE 2-RHCBP (DC ESS BUS 2 FLIGHT CONTROLS) On the MCDU ( AMM SDS 34-61-00/1), use the sequence in parentheses to open these SSPCs: E1 START VLV-SPDA2 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ENGINE) E2 START VLV-SPDA2 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ENGINE) Get access to the middle avionics compartment as follows: Open the access door 199AL Open and remove access door 147AL ( AMM TASK 52-46-00-000-801-A/400). Open these circuit breakers and put a Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) on each one of them: E1 REVERSER-LICC (DC BUS 1) E2 REVERSER-RICC (DC BUS 2). Deactivate the ICU ( AMM TASK 78-33-01-040-801-A/200). Use a Commercially available workstand (engine and pylon) to get access to the area that you will examine. Remove the access panels: 419ACL, 419WL, 419ADR, 419UR, 429AER, 429XR, 429ADL and 429TL ( AMM TASK 54-50-21-000-801-A/400 and AMM TASK 54-50-22-000-801-A/400) to get access to the area where you will do the inspection. Remove foreign materials from the panel surfaces with a Commercially available lint-free wiper cloth soaked in water. Dry the panel surfaces with a clean cloth. DO NOT OPERATE THE ENGINE OR PRESSURIZE THE BLEED AIR SYSTEM. THE BLEED AIR WILL FLOW OUT OF THE BLEED AIR LINE AND CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONS. DO NOT TOUCH THE BLEED-AIR SYSTEM DUCTS OR COMPONENTS IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE ENGINE OR APU STOPS. THE HIGH TEMPERATURE OF THE BLEED-AIR CAN CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONS. Draw a grid in the area of the panel surface where you will do the inspection. The largest square must not be more than ½ of the transducer diameter. Put the panel on a suitable stand. Put a code label on the panel surface. Equipment Calibration Calibrate the instrument as follows: Manually set the KRAUTKRAMER USIP 12. Connect the equipment to a 220 VAC, 50 Hz power source. Turn on the equipment and wait 15 mins. The equipment will become warm. Connect the transducer cable to the transducer (microdot connector) and to LEMO-BNC adaptor. Connect the LEMO to the connector marked with a “T” on the USIP 12. Apply couplant to the panel and put the transducer delay line on the panel. Move the transducer back and forth to get the a better response from the back surface of the panel. Adjust the GAIN control to get approximately 100% of CRT screen. Do a check for instrument sensitivity. Slide the transducer along the edge of the defective areas. Make sure that you find all defects easily and that their response is higher than 50% of CRT saturation. Apply a layer of jelly couplant on your index finger and hold your finger on the back of the panel, aligned with the deeper defect. This is to make sure that you get a response from the deeper defect from a ply and not from the back surface of the panel. If there is a defect, the intensity of the signal will not decrease. Calibrate the instrument as follows: Scan the panel to make sure that you find all induced flaws. After you finish the calibration, keep the equipment setting. Then do an inspection of the applicable areas of the panel. Refer to the specific NDT procedure. Determine the shape and size of the defect as follows: Do the steps that follow only if the shape and size of defect are necessary. Slide the probe along the defect and take note of the maximum response. Use the center of the transducer as a reference point. Move the transducer on the defect along the scanning direction until the signal decreases to 50% (6 dB attenuation). Mark the position on the surface. Move the transducer toward the defective area until the signal reaches maximum response and decreases to 50% again. Mark the position on the surface. The distance between the marks is the length of the defect along the scanning line. Do the Item 7.C.(1) thru Item 7.C.(3), along two other scanning lines. Draw a continuous line that touches all marks. The area inside the line is the area of the defect. Determine the depth of the defect as follows: Do the steps that follow only if the depth of defect is necessary. Calibrate the CRT screen horizontal scale. Use the suitable standard panel. Put the transducer on a point of the standard panel where the thickness is greater than the defect depth or the skin thickness. Use the delay control knob to adjust the front surface reflection at the first index mark (left side of the CRT screen). Adjust the material velocity (MLT) control. Bring the back surface reflection on the right side of the CRT screen grid marked 10 (or 5 as convenient). Each main grid mark represents t/10 mm (or t/5 mm) of the carbon fiber material depth. Procedure (Figure 1) You must do the scanning in radii in the longitudinal and transverse directions, with special attention to the edge effect. Make sure that the probe is set as close as possible to 90° to the surface of the part. Scan the whole area of interest. Refer to Figure 1. Indication Evaluation Note the locations of questionable crack-like indications. Repeat the inspection with special attention to the areas where the indications were noted. Record all locations and responses to all crack indications. Acceptance and Rejection Criteria If there are signs of damage, refer to SRM to find the specific information related to your case. If the SRM does not contain the information related to your case, contact Embraer. Job Close-Up Install these access panels: 419ACL, 419WL, 419ADR, 419UR, 429AER, 429XR, 429ADL and 429TL ( AMM TASK 54-50-21-400-801-A/400 and AMM TASK 54-50-22-400-801-A/400). Remove the Commercially available workstand (engine and pylon) and all tools, equipment and unwanted materials from the worked area. Start the ICU ( AMM TASK 78-33-01-440-801-A/200). Remove the Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) from each of these circuit breakers and close them: E2 REVERSER-RICC (DC BUS 2) E1 REVERSER-LICC (DC BUS 1). Close the access to the middle avionics compartment as follows: Install and close the access door 147AL ( AMM TASK 52-46-00-400-801-A/400) Close the access door 199AL. On the MCDU ( AMM SDS 34-61-00/1), use the sequence in parentheses to close these SSPCs: E1 START VLV-SPDA2 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ENGINE) E2 START VLV-SPDA2 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ENGINE) Remove the Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) from each one of these circuit breakers and close them: SLAT ACE 1-LHCBP (DC BUS 1 FLIGHT CONTROLS) SLAT ACE 2-RHCBP (DC ESS BUS 2 FLIGHT CONTROLS) Disconnect the external AC power supply from the aircraft ( AMM TASK 24-42-02-860-802-A/200). Put the aircraft back to its initial condition. Figure 1 - Pylon Lower Link Fitting (Pylon and Wing Fittings) - Internal Ultrasonic Inspection Figure 1, Sheet 1

Rudder Structure - Internal General This task gives the procedure to do a special detailed inspection of the rudder structure, using an ultrasonic technique. This inspection is applicable to zone 325. This inspection is applicable to 55-40-001 Structural Significant Item(s): 55-40-001 - RUDDER SKIN. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 Aircraft Maintenance Safety Procedures - Standard Procedures AMM TASK 52-46-00-000-801-A/400 Middle Avionics-Compartment Access-Door - Removal AMM TASK 52-46-00-400-801-A/400 Middle Avionics-Compartment Access-Door - Installation AMM SDS 52-43-00/1 FORWARD AVIONICS-COMPARTMENT ACCESS-HATCH NDT PART 1 TASK 51-00-00-914-801-A Ultrasonic Inspection Method by Manual Ultrasonic Contact Pulse-Echo Inspection Technique
Zones and Accesses ZONES ACCESS LOCATION REFERENCE 123BL LH FWD Fuselage Bottom - Front Area AMM TASK 06-41-00-800-801-A/100 147AL LH Center Fuselage II Bottom - Middle Avionics Compartment AMM TASK 06-41-00-800-801-A/100 199AL Wing-to-Fuselage Fairing LH Aft Panel AMM TASK 06-41-00-800-801-A/100 325 Rudder AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100
Tools and Equipment REFERENCE DESIGNATION Commercially available Workstand - Vertical Stabilizer Top Commercially available Circuit Breaker Ring and Tag (Inoperative - Do Not Operate)
Circuit Breakers List TYPE DESIGNATION LOCATION BUS LOCATION TIP MCDU PAGE CB HYD1 PUMP PWR RICC AC BUS 2 - HYD CB HYD3 PUMP A PWR EICC AC ESS BUS - HYD CB HYD3 PUMP B PWR RICC AC BUS 2 - HYD
Job Set-Up YOU MUST PREVENT ALL POSSIBLE OPERATION OF THE HORIZONTAL STABILIZER WHEN YOU WORK ON OR NEAR IT. THE HORIZONTAL STABILIZER MOVES QUICKLY AND WITH FORCE. IF THE STABILIZER MOVES WHEN PERSONS ARE IN THE TORSION BOX COMPARTMENT OR NEAR THE STABILIZER, IT CAN CAUSE INJURY TO THEM. MAKE SURE THAT THERE WILL BE NO ACCIDENTAL OPERATION OF THE ELEVATOR. AN ACCIDENTAL OPERATION OF THE ELEVATOR CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS. Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Open the access hatch 123BL to get access to the forward avionics compartment ( AMM SDS 52-43-00/1). In the forward avionics compartment, open this circuit breaker and put a Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) on it: HYD3 PUMP A PWR-EICC (AC ESS BUS) Get access to the middle avionics compartment as follows: Open the access door 199AL. Open and remove the access door 147AL ( AMM TASK 52-46-00-000-801-A/400). In the middle avionics compartment, open these circuit breakers and put a Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) on each one of them: HYD1 PUMP PWR-RICC (AC BUS 2) HYD3 PUMP B PWR-RICC (AC BUS 2) Use a Commercially available workstand (vertical stabilizer top) to get access to the area where you will do the inspection. Procedure Delimit the boundaries of the area where you will be done the ultrasonic inspection with adhesive tape according to Figure 1. Do an internal inspection of the external side from rudder for delaminations, voids and cracks. Use an ultrasonic technique to do the inspection (NDT PART 1 TASK 51-00-00-914-801-A). The technician in charge of the accomplishment of this inspection must have at least a level II qualification in ultrasonic inspection, in accordance with MILSTD- 410E of ATA specification 105, demonstrated through a certificate issued by a certifying agency. Indication Evaluation Record the dimensions and location of the damage indication. Acceptance and Rejection Criteria If there are signs of damage, refer to the SRM to find the specific information related to your case. If the SRM does not contain the information related to your case, contact Embraer. Job Close-Up Remove the adhesive tape. Remove the Commercially available workstand (vertical stabilizer top) from the area where you did the inspection. In the forward avionics compartment, remove the Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) from this circuit breaker and close it: HYD3 PUMP A PWR-EICC (AC ESS BUS) Close the forward avionics-compartment access-hatch 123BL ( AMM SDS 52-43-00/1). In the middle avionics compartment, remove the Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) from these circuit breakers and close them: HYD1 PUMP PWR-RICC (AC BUS 2) HYD3 PUMP B PWR-RICC (AC BUS 2) Close the middle avionics-compartment access-door 147AL ( AMM TASK 52-46-00-400-801-A/400). Close the access door 199AL. Put the aircraft back to its initial condition. Figure 1 - Special Detailed Inspection of Rudder Structure, LH/RH, by using an Ultrasonic Technique Figure 1, Sheet 1 Figure 2 - Special Detailed Inspection of Rudder Structure, LH/RH, by using an Ultrasonic Technique Figure 2, Sheet 1 Figure 3 - Special Detailed Inspection of Rudder Structure, LH/RH, by using an Ultrasonic Technique Figure 3, Sheet 1 Figure 4 - Special Detailed Inspection of Rudder Structure, LH/RH, by using an Ultrasonic Technique Figure 4, Sheet 1

Updated the AMM reference task Wing Lower Skin Panel - Internal General This task gives the procedure to do an internal ultrasonic inspection (by the manual contact pulse-echo inspection technique) of the wing lower-skin panels, from the internal side of the wing main box. You must do this inspection of wing lower-skin panels on the pylon fittings and flap track support fittings region ( LH/ RH). To use this inspection method, you must get access to at least one surface of the part, near the area where you will do the inspection. The inspection is applicable to zones 521, 531, 541, 621, 631, and 641. The inspection is applicable to SSI 57-10-007. Structural Significant Item(s): 57-10-007 - WING LOWER SKIN PANELS. Tools and Equipment REFERENCE DESIGNATION Commercially available Workstand - slats Commercially available Wiper cloth, lint-free
Job Set-Up MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. MAKE SURE THAT THE FLIGHT-CONTROL SAFETY LOCKS AND THE WARNING NOTICES ARE IN POSITION. THIS IS TO PREVENT AN ACCIDENTAL COMMAND OF THE FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES AND INJURY TO PERSONS. MAKE SURE THAT HYDRAULIC POWER IS NOT SUPPLIED. IF HYDRAULIC POWER IS SUPPLIED, THE FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES CAN MOVE DURING THIS PROCEDURE. THIS CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS OR DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT. Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). READ THE FUEL SYSTEM SAFETY PRECAUTIONS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. THE FUEL VAPORS ARE TOXIC AND CAN CAUSE IRRITATION TO THE SKIN AND EYES. PUT ON MASK AND GLOVES AND DO NOT BREATHE FUEL VAPORS. DO NOT LET THE AIR/FUEL MIXTURE COME TO AN EXPLOSIVE LEVEL. DO THE TEST IN AREAS WITH A GOOD AIRFLOW. Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance of the fuel system ( AMM TASK 28-00-00-910-801-A/200). Defuel the aircraft ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-650-802-A/300). Drain the remaining fuel from the fuel tank ( AMM TASK 12-11-05-680-802-A/300 ). Obey the instructions given in AMM TASK 28-00-00-910-801-A/200. Put the Commercially available workstand (slats) in the work area. Remove access panels 521AB, 521BB, 521CB, 521DB, 521EB, 531AB, 531HB, 531BB, 531CB, 531DB, 531EB, 531FB, 531GB, 541AB, 541BB, 541CB, 541DB, 541EB, 621AB, 621BB, 621CB, 621DB, 621EB, 631AB, 631HB, 631BB, 631CB, 631DB, 631EB, 631FB, 631GB, 641AB, 641BB, 641CB, 641DB, and 641EB. Remove foreign materials from the panel surfaces with a Commercially available lint-free wiper cloth soaked in water. Dry the panel surfaces with a clean cloth. Draw a grid in the area of the panel surface where you will do the inspection. The largest square must not be more than ½ of the transducer diameter. Put the panel on a suitable stand. Put a code label on the panel surface. Equipment Calibration Calibrate the instrument as follows: Manually set the KRAUTKRAMER USIP 12. Connect the equipment to a 220 VAC, 50 Hz power source. Turn on the equipment and wait 15 min. The equipment will become warm. Connect the transducer cable to the transducer (microdot connector) and to the LEMO-BNC adaptor. Connect the LEMO to the connector marked with a “T” on the USIP 12. Apply couplant to the panel and put the transducer delay line on the panel. Move the transducer back and forth to get the a better response from the back surface of the panel. Adjust the GAIN control to get approximately 100% of CRT screen. Do a check for instrument sensitivity. Slide the transducer along the edge of the defective areas. Make sure that you easily find all defects and that their response is higher than 50% of CRT saturation. Apply a layer of jelly couplant on your index finger and hold your finger on the back of the panel, aligned with the deeper defect. This is to make sure that you get a response from the deeper defect from a ply and not from the back surface of the panel. If there is a defect, the intensity of the signal will not decrease. Calibrate the instrument as follows: Scan the panel to make sure that you find all induced flaws. After you finish the calibration, keep the equipment setting. Then do an inspection of the applicable areas of the panel. Refer to the specific NDT procedure. Determine the shape and size of the defect as follows: Do the steps that follow only if information about the shape and size of the defect is necessary. Slide the probe along the defect and take note of the maximum response. Use the center of the transducer as a reference point. Move the transducer on the defect along the scanning direction until the signal decreases to 50% (6 dB attenuation). Mark the position on the surface. Move the transducer toward the defective area until the signal reaches maximum response and decreases to 50% again. Mark the position on the surface. The distance between the marks is the length of the defect along the scanning line. Do Item 6.C.(1) thru Item 6.C.(3)along two others scanning lines. Draw a continuous line that touches all marks. The area inside the line is the area of the defect. Determine the depth of the defect as follows: Do the steps that follow only if information about the depth of the defect is necessary. Calibrate the CRT screen horizontal scale. Use the suitable standard panel. Put the transducer on a point of the standard panel where the thickness is greater than the defect depth or the skin thickness. Use the delay control knob to adjust the front surface reflection at the first index mark (left side of the CRT screen). Adjust the material velocity (MLT) control. Bring the back surface reflection on the right side of the CRT screen grid marked 10 (or 5 as convenient). Each main grid mark represents t/10 mm (or t/5 mm) of the carbon fiber material depth. Procedure (Figure 1) You must scan the radii in the longitudinal and transverse directions, with attention to the edge effect. Make sure that the probe is set as close as possible to 90° to the surface of the part. Scan the whole area of interest. Refer to Figure 1. Indication Evaluation Record all locations and responses to all crack indications. Acceptance and Rejection Criteria If there are signs of damage, refer to SRM to find the specific information related to your case. If the SRM does not contain the information related to your case, tell Embraer. Job Close-Up BEFORE YOU USE CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUNDS AND CLEANERS ALWAYS REFER TO THE MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEET AND OBEY ALL SAFETY AND HEALTH PRECAUTIONS. SOLVENTS IN CIC ARE DANGEROUS. TO USE CIC IN CLOSED AREAS, PUT ON RESPIRATORY AND SKIN PROTECTION AND MAKE SURE THAT THE AREA HAS A GOOD AIRFLOW. THESE MATERIALS ARE DANGEROUS AND CAN CAUSE INJURIES OR ILLNESSES IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THESE PRECAUTIONS. After the inspection, apply CIC only to the areas from which it was removed ( CPM PART 1 TASK 51-25-00-910-001-A). Install access panels 521AB, 521BB, 521CB, 521DB, 521EB, 531AB, 531HB, 531BB, 531CB, 531DB, 531EB, 531FB, 531GB, 541AB, 541BB, 541CB, 541DB, 541EB, 621AB, 621BB, 621CB, 621DB, 621EB, 631AB, 631HB, 631BB, 631CB, 631DB, 631EB, 631FB, 631GB, 641AB, 641BB, 641CB, 641DB, and 641EB. Remove all tools, equipment, and unwanted materials from the work area. Remove the Commercially available workstand (slats) from the work area. Refuel the aircraft ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-650-801-A/300). Put the aircraft back to its initial condition ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Figure 1 - Wing Lower Skin Panels - Internal Ultrasonic Inspection Figure 1, Sheet 1

Inboard and Outboard Main and Inboard Aft Flap Structure - Internal General This task gives the procedure to do a special detailed inspection of the Inboard Main and Outboard Flap Structure ( RH and LH), by the ultrasonic technique. To use this inspection method, you must get access to at least one surface of the part, near the area where you will do the inspection. This inspection is applicable to zones 561, 562, 571, 661, 662, and 671. This inspection is applicable to the SSI 57-50-032. Structural Significant Item(s): 57-50-032 - INBOARD AND OUTBOARD MAIN AND INBOARD AFT FLAP SKINS. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 Aircraft Maintenance Safety Procedures - Standard Procedures NDT PART 1 TASK 51-00-00-914-801-A Ultrasonic Inspection Method by Manual Ultrasonic Contact Pulse-Echo Inspection Technique
Zones and Accesses ZONES ACCESS LOCATION REFERENCE 561 Inboard Main Flap - LH Wing AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100 562 Inboard Aft Flap - LH Wing AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100 571 Outboard Main Flap - LH Wing AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100 661 Inboard Main Flap - RH Wing AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100 662 Inboard Aft Flap - RH Wing AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100 671 Outboard Main Flap - RH Wing AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100
Tools and Equipment REFERENCE DESIGNATION ITEM GSE 029 TOOL - SLAT CONTROL LEVER LOCKING Commercially available Workstand - slats Commercially available Circuit Breaker Ring and Tag (Inoperative - Do Not Operate) Commercially Available Workstand - flaps
Circuit Breakers List TYPE DESIGNATION LOCATION BUS LOCATION TIP MCDU PAGE CB FLAP ACE 1 LHCBP DC ESS BUS 1 FLIGHT CONTROLS - CB FLAP ACE 2 RHCBP DC ESS BUS 3 FLIGHT CONTROLS -
Job Set-Up MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Set the flaps to the fully extended position. MAKE SURE THAT THE FLIGHT-CONTROL SAFETY LOCKS AND THE WARNING NOTICES ARE IN POSITION. THIS IS TO PREVENT AN ACCIDENTAL COMMAND OF THE FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES AND INJURY TO PERSONS. Install the locking tool GSE 029 TOOL - SLAT CONTROL LEVER LOCKING on the FLAP control lever. Open these circuit breakers and put a Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) on each one of them: FLAP ACE 1-LHCBP (DC ESS BUS 1 FLIGHT CONTROLS) FLAP ACE 2-RHCBP (DC ESS BUS 3 FLIGHT CONTROLS) Use a Commercially Available workstand (flaps) to get access to the work area. Procedure Delimit the boundaries of the area where you will be done the ultrasonic inspection with adhesive tape according to Figure 1, Sheet 1 and Figure 1, Sheet 2. Do an special detailed inspection of the Inboard Main and Outboard Flap Structure ( RH and LH). Use an ultrasonic technique to do the inspection (NDT PART 1 TASK 51-00-00-914-801-A) Scanning in radii must be made in longitudinal and traverse directions, with attention being paid to the edge effect. Make sure that the probe is set as close as possible to 90 degrees to the surface of the part. Scan the whole area of interest. Refer to Figure 1. Make sure that: There is no delamination or other signs of damage. Indication Evaluation Note the locations of any questionable damage indications. Do the inspection again. Pay attention to the areas where the indications were noted. Record all locations and responses to all damage indications. Acceptance and Rejection Criteria If there are signs of damage, refer to the SRM to find the specific information applicable to your case. If the SRM does not contain the information related to your case, contact Embraer. Job Close-Up Remove the Commercially available workstand (slats) . Remove the Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) from each of these circuit breaker, and close them: FLAP ACE 1-LHCBP (DC ESS BUS 1 FLIGHT CONTROLS) FLAP ACE 2-RHCBP (DC ESS BUS 3 FLIGHT CONTROLS) Remove the locking tool GSE 029 TOOL - SLAT CONTROL LEVER LOCKING from the SLAT/FLAP control lever. Set the flaps to the fully retracted position. Put the A/C back to its initial condition ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Figure 1 - Special Detailed Inspection of the Inboard Main and Outboard Flap Structure (RH and LH), by the Ultrasonic Technique. Figure 1, Sheet 1 Figure 1, Sheet 2

Trunnion Fittings - External General This task gives the procedure to do a special detailed inspection (ultrasonic technique) of the doubler installed between fixed trailing edge rib 05 and lower panel, from the external side of fixed trailing edge lower skin. This inspection is applicable to RH and LH wings in zones 522 and 622. This inspection is applicable to the SSI 57-50-007. Structural Significant Item(s): 57-50-007 - TRUNNION FITTINGS. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 Aircraft Maintenance Safety Procedures - Standard Procedures NDT PART 1 TASK 51-00-00-914-801-A Ultrasonic Inspection Method by Manual Ultrasonic Contact Pulse-Echo Inspection Technique

Circuit Breakers List TYPE DESIGNATION LOCATION BUS LOCATION TIP MCDU PAGE CB FLAP ACE 1 LHCBP DC ESS BUS 1 FLIGHT CONTROLS - CB FLAP ACE 2 RHCBP DC ESS BUS 3 FLIGHT CONTROLS -
Job Set-Up MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Put warning signs in the work area. Put a Commercially available workstand (landing gears) in the work area. Install the locking tool GSE 029 TOOL - SLAT CONTROL LEVER LOCKING to the SFCL. On the CBP, open these circuit breakers and put a Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) on each one of them: FLAP ACE 1-LHCBP (DC ESS BUS 1 FLIGHT CONTROLS) FLAP ACE 2-RHCBP (DC ESS BUS 3 FLIGHT CONTROLS) Before you do the inspection, clean the area with a lint-free wiper cloth soaked with water. Procedure Delimit the boundaries of the area where you will be done the ultrasonic inspection with adhesive tape. Do a special detailed inspection of the doubler installed between fixed trailing edge rib 05 and lower panel ( RH and LH). Use an ultrasonic technique to do the inspection (NDT PART 1 TASK 51-00-00-914-801-A) Scanning in radii must be made in longitudinal and traverse directions, with attention being paid to the edge effect. Make sure that the probe is set as close as possible to 90 degrees to the surface of the part. Scan the whole area of interest. Refer to Figure 1. Make sure that the components show no signs of damage. Indication Evaluation Note the locations of any questionable damage indications. Do the inspection again. Pay attention to the areas where the indications were noted. Record all locations and responses to all damage indications. Acceptance and Rejection Criteria If there are signs of damage, refer to the SRM to find the specific information applicable to your case. If the SRM does not contain the information related to your case, contact Embraer. Job Close-Up On the CBP, remove the Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) from each one of these circuit breakers and close them: FLAP ACE 1-LHCBP (DC ESS BUS 1 FLIGHT CONTROLS) FLAP ACE 2-RHCBP (DC ESS BUS 3 FLIGHT CONTROLS) Remove the locking tool GSE 029 TOOL - SLAT CONTROL LEVER LOCKING from the SFCL. Remove the Commercially available workstand (landing gears) from the work area. Remove all tools, equipment and unwanted material from the work area.. Put the aircraft back to its initial condition ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Figure 1 - Trunnion Fittings - External Figure 1, Sheet 1

Aileron Structure - Internal General This task gives the procedure to do a special detailed inspection of the aileron structure ( RH and LH), by the ultrasonic manual-contact pulse-echo inspection technique. Do the internal inspection from the external side of aileron. To use this inspection method, you must get access to at least one surface of the part, near the area where you will do the inspection. This inspection is applicable to zones 581 and 681. This inspection is applicable to the SSI 57-60-002. Structural Significant Item(s): 57-60-002 - AILERON SKIN. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 Aircraft Maintenance Safety Procedures - Standard Procedures
Zones and Accesses ZONES ACCESS LOCATION REFERENCE 581 Aileron - LH Wing AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100 681 Aileron - RH Wing AMM TASK 06-30-00-800-802-A/100
Tools and Equipment REFERENCE DESIGNATION ITEM GSE 233 RIGGING PINS, FLIGHT CONTROLS - SET Commercially available Workstand - slats Commercially available Circuit Breaker Ring and Tag (Inoperative - Do Not Operate)
Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESIGNATION PART NUMBER REFERENCE ASTM-D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone MEK CPC SECTION 07
Circuit Breakers List TYPE DESIGNATION LOCATION BUS LOCATION TIP MCDU PAGE SSPC ACMP2B CMD SPDA1 DC BUS 1 SPDA1-M4 HYD SSPC ACMP3B CMD SPDA2 DC BUS 2 SPDA2-M3 HYD SSPC E1 START VLV SPDA2 DC ESS BUS 1 SPDA2-M4 ENGINE CB HYDR ELEC PUMP SYS 2 LHCBP DC BUS 1 - - CB HYDR ELEC PUMP SYS 3A LHCBP DC ESS BUS 1 - -
Job Set-Up MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. MAKE SURE THAT THE FLIGHT-CONTROL SAFETY LOCKS AND THE WARNING NOTICES ARE IN POSITION. THIS IS TO PREVENT AN ACCIDENTAL COMMAND OF THE FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES AND INJURY TO PERSONS. MAKE SURE THAT HYDRAULIC POWER IS NOT SUPPLIED. IF HYDRAULIC POWER IS SUPPLIED, THE FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES CAN MOVE DURING THIS PROCEDURE. THIS CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS OR DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT. CLEANING PRODUCTS ARE TOXIC AND FLAMMABLE. A GOOD AIRFLOW MUST BE AVAILABLE WHEN YOU DO THE WORK IN CLOSED AREAS. Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Install the GSE 233 RIGGING PINS, FLIGHT CONTROLS - SET (rigging pins) on the control yokes. Open these circuit breakers and put a Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) on each one of them: E1 START VLV-SPDA2 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ENGINE) HYDR ELEC PUMP SYS 2-LHCBP (DC BUS 1) ACMP2B CMD-SPDA1 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/HYD) HYDR ELEC PUMP SYS 3A-LHCBP (DC ESS BUS 1) ACMP3B CMD-SPDA2 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/HYD) Use a Commercially available workstand (slats) to get access to the work area. Put warning signs in the work area. Clean the area with MEK . Equipment Calibration Calibrate the instrument as follows: Manually set the KRAUTKRAMER USIP 12. Connect the equipment to a 220 VAC, 50 Hz power source. Turn on the equipment and wait 15 mins. The equipment will become warm. Connect the transducer cable to the transducer (microdot connector) and to LEMO-BNC adaptor. Connect the LEMO to the connector marked with a “T” on the USIP 12. Apply couplant to the panel and put the transducer delay line on the panel. Move the transducer back and forth to get a better response from the back surface of the panel. Adjust the GAIN control to get approximately 100% of CRT screen. Do a check for instrument sensitivity. Slide the transducer along the edge of the defective areas. Make sure that you find all defects easily and that their response is higher than 50% of CRT saturation. Apply a layer of jelly couplant on your index finger and hold your finger on the back of the panel, aligned with the deeper defect. This is to make sure that you get a response from the deeper defect from a ply and not from the back surface of the panel. If there is a defect, the intensity of the signal will not decrease. Calibrate the instrument as follows: Scan the panel to make sure that you find all induced flaws. After you finish the calibration, keep the equipment setting. Then do an inspection of the applicable areas of the panel. Determine the shape and size of the defect as follows: Do the steps that follow only if the shape and size of defect are necessary. Slide the probe along the defect and take note of the maximum response. Use the center of the transducer as a reference point. Move the transducer on the defect along the scanning direction until the signal decreases to 50% (6 dB attenuation). Mark the position on the surface. Move the transducer toward the defective area until the signal reaches maximum response and decreases to 50% again. Mark the position on the surface. The distance between the marks is the length of the defect along the scanning line. Do Item 8.C.(1) thru Item 8.C.(3), along two others scanning lines. Draw a continuous line that touches all marks. The area inside the line is the area of the defect. Determine the depth of the defect as follows: Do the steps that follow only if the depth of defect is necessary. Calibrate the CRT screen horizontal scale. Use the suitable standard panel. Put the transducer on a point of the standard panel where the thickness is greater than the defect depth or the skin thickness. Use the delay control knob to adjust the front surface reflection at the first index mark (left side of the CRT screen). Adjust the material velocity (MLT) control. Bring the back surface reflection on the right side of the CRT screen grid marked 10 (or 5 as convenient). Each main grid mark represents t/10 mm (or t/5 mm) of the carbon fiber material depth. Procedure Scanning in radii must be made in longitudinal and traverse directions, with attention being paid to the edge effect. Make sure that the probe is set as close as possible to 90 degrees to the surface of the part. Scan the whole area of interest. Refer to Figure 1. Indication Evaluation Note the locations of any questionable crack indications. Do the inspection again. Pay attention to the areas where the indications were noted. Record all locations and responses to all crack indications. Acceptance and Rejection Criteria If there are signs of damage, refer to the SRM to find the specific information applicable to your case. If the SRM does not contain the information related to your case, contact Embraer. Job Close-Up Remove the warning signs from the work area. Remove the Commercially available workstand (slats) . Remove the GSE 233 RIGGING PINS, FLIGHT CONTROLS - SET (rigging pins) from the control yokes. Remove the Commercially available circuit breaker ring and tag (inoperative - do not operate) from each of these CB and close them: E1 START VLV-SPDA2 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/ENGINE) HYDR ELEC PUMP SYS 2-LHCBP (DC BUS 1) ACMP2B CMD-SPDA1 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/HYD) HYDR ELEC PUMP SYS 3A-LHCBP (DC ESS BUS 1) ACMP3B CMD-SPDA2 (CBMENU/CB BY SYS/HYD) Put the A/C back to its initial condition ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). Figure 1 - Aileron Structure - Ultrasonic Technique Inspection Figure 1, Sheet 1
